types_description: Skin cancer is one of the most common types of cancer, and understanding its varieties can help with early detection and treatment. Below are the seven types of skin cancer this app is designed to recognize.
bcc_description: The most common and least dangerous type of skin cancer. It often appears as a small, shiny bump or patch of red skin.
melanoma_description: The most dangerous type of skin cancer. It may develop in existing moles or as new dark, irregular spots.
nevus_description: Commonly known as moles, these are usually benign skin growths caused by clusters of pigmented cells. While most are harmless, changes in size, shape, or color may require medical attention to rule out melanoma.
vascular_description: Abnormalities of blood vessels that appear as red, purple, or blue marks on the skin. These lesions are usually benign but may require treatment for cosmetic reasons or if they cause symptoms.
keratosis_description: A precancerous condition caused by sun damage, appearing as rough, scaly patches on exposed skin.
dermatofibroma_description: A benign, firm, small skin nodule that often appears on the lower legs. It is usually painless but may feel tender when pressed. Dermatofibromas are non-cancerous and generally harmless.
benign_keratosis_description: A non-cancerous growth that often appears as rough, raised, or warty spots on the skin. These growths are harmless and common in older adults, typically caused by sun exposure or aging.
early_detection_title: Early Detection: Your Best Defense Against Skin Cancer
skin_cancer_occurs: Skin cancer occurs when skin cells grow uncontrollably due to DNA damage, often from UV rays from the sun or tanning beds. There are three main types of skin cancer:
protect_skin: Protect Your Skin from the Sun:
use_sunscreen: • Use sunscreen daily with SPF 30 or higher.
wear_hat: • Wear a hat and sunglasses when outdoors.
avoid_direct_sunlight: • Avoid direct sunlight during peak hours.
examine_monthly: • Examine your skin monthly in front of a mirror.
look_for_changes: • Look for unusual changes, such as dark spots or new moles.
notice_wounds: • If you notice wounds that don't heal or bleeding spots, consult a doctor.

privacy_policy_title: Privacy Policy for Skin Cancer Detection App
introduction_text: At Skin Cancer Detection, we value and respect your privacy. This Privacy Policy outlines how we collect, use, and protect your personal information when you use our app, which uses AI technology to assist in skin cancer detection.
info_collect_text:
We collect the following information:

- Personal information: When you create an account, we may collect your name, email address, and other contact details.
- Health-related information: You may upload images or provide details related to your skin health for analysis.
- Usage data: We collect information about how you interact with the app, including device information, IP address, and log data.
info_use_text:
We use the information we collect to:

- Provide personalized skin cancer detection results through our AI-based system.
- Improve the performance and accuracy of our app.
- Communicate with you regarding your account or updates to the app.
- Analyze app usage to enhance user experience.
data_security_text: We implement various security measures to protect your personal and health-related data. All sensitive information is transmitted using encryption, and we store it securely in our systems. However, no method of data transmission over the internet or electronic storage is 100% secure, and we cannot guarantee absolute security.
data_sharing_text: We do not sell, trade, or rent your personal information to third parties. However, we may share data with trusted service providers who assist us in running our app, provided they agree to keep this information confidential. We may also share data when required by law or to protect the rights and safety of our users.
ai_analysis_text: The app uses AI to analyze images you upload for skin cancer detection. The AI model is trained using a large dataset of images, and it provides diagnostic suggestions based on patterns it recognizes. The results are for informational purposes only, and should not replace professional medical advice.
user_rights_text:
You have the right to:

- Access and update your personal information.
- Request deletion of your data, subject to certain legal restrictions.
- Opt-out of receiving marketing communications from us.
- Request a copy of the data we have collected about you.
policy_changes_text: We reserve the right to update this Privacy Policy from time to time. Any changes will be reflected in the app and on this page. We encourage you to review this policy periodically to stay informed about how we are protecting your information.
contact_us_text: If you have any questions or concerns about our Privacy Policy, please contact us at: support@skincancerdetection.com
